data.title: a16z calls on the US Department of Justice to stop requiring DeFi protocols to be responsible for user behavior
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Venture capital firm a16z issued an article stating that the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) should stop holding DeFi protocols accountable for illegal activities that they did not instigate and cannot control.
The article pointed out: "Holding people accountable for systems and activities over which they have no power or control will lead to adverse consequences. Unfortunately, the Department of Justice ignored this distinction and tried to do this by holding software developers accountable for the actions of third parties who use neutral tools that they originally created but no longer control."
The agency said that the "biggest policy focus" of the new U.S. presidential administration on cryptocurrencies should be "codifying the correct and legal understanding of 'control' in the law."
a16z believes that this is particularly important for determining whether a cryptocurrency company qualifies as a "funds transmission business" because the business needs to comply with specific rules and obligations.
According to the official website, a16z's venture capital investment portfolio covers more than 100 cryptocurrency companies, including DEXs such as Uniswap.

data.title: A whale deposited AAVE, LINK, UNI and other tokens into Binance 8 hours ago, equivalent to about 7.96 million US dollars
Tether launches AI SDK platform to promote the integration of AI and crypto applications
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino announced the launch of the AI ​​SDK platform on X. Built on a Bare JavaScript runtime, the AI ​​SDK is compatible with a variety of hardware systems, including embedded devices. The open source platform is designed to facilitate the integration of artificial intelligence with cryptocurrency-related applications.
This AI SDK will support a variety of functions, such as AI translation, AI voice assistant, and AI Bitcoin wallet assistant. These tools are expected to enhance the accessibility of crypto transactions, making interactions more efficient and user-friendly.

data.title: ETH supply exceeds Ethereum pre-merger level
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News According to Ultrasound data, the current supply of ETH has exceeded the level before the Ethereum PoS merger. Data shows that the current ETH supply is 120,521,291, an increase from 120,521,140.92 at the time of the merger on September 15, 2022. Since Ethereum completed the transition to the Proof of Stake (PoS) mechanism, 1,947,607.01 ETH has been destroyed, and 1,947,757.18 ETH have been newly issued, with a net supply increase of 150.17 ETH.

data.title: Gavin Wood: Polkadot’s Satoshi coefficient reaches 149, and its degree of decentralization far exceeds Ethereum and Solana
Matrixport: There is a clear technical divergence between Bitcoin price and RSI, indicating that its momentum is weakening
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Matrixport released today's chart saying that there is a clear technical divergence between the price of Bitcoin and the relative strength index (RSI). Although the price of Bitcoin has remained above $100,000, the RSI has been in a consolidation state, indicating that the momentum of the underlying trend is weakening.
Looking back at the correction and consolidation phases before 2024, strong buying opportunities have historically only occurred when the RSI fell to about 40%. At present, although the RSI is close to that level (48%), it has not yet reached it, so it may be too early to enter a new long position. A more strategic approach is to remain patient and wait for the best entry point.

data.title: El Salvador Expands Bitcoin Holdings Amid Market Dip
data.description:
According to Cointelegraph, El Salvador has increased its Bitcoin reserves by purchasing 12 Bitcoin during a recent market downturn. On February 4, the country acquired 11 Bitcoin for just over $1.1 million, averaging $101,816 per Bitcoin. An additional Bitcoin was later bought for $99,114, as reported by the government's Bitcoin Office tracker. This acquisition brings El Salvador's total Bitcoin holdings to 6,068 BTC, valued at over $554 million.

The Bitcoin Office announced in a February 4 post on X that El Salvador had accumulated 21 BTC over the week, with a total of 60 BTC purchased in the past 30 days. The post highlighted the growth of the world's first Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, emphasizing El Salvador's continued success in expanding its cryptocurrency assets.

Bitcoin experienced a 24-hour low of approximately $96,000 but has since recovered to around $98,000, though it remains below its intraday high of over $100,700, according to CoinGecko data. The recent Bitcoin purchases follow a $1.4 billion financing agreement between El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) last month. As part of the agreement, the government agreed to reduce some of its Bitcoin-related activities.

Changes implemented by El Salvador include making Bitcoin acceptance voluntary for the private sector and reducing government involvement in the Chivo crypto wallet. On January 29, Reuters reported that El Salvador's Congress quickly approved legislation to amend its Bitcoin laws to align with the IMF deal, which President Bukele had submitted shortly before.

Despite the IMF agreement, El Salvador's government continues to invest in Bitcoin. The day after the deal was made, the country purchased $1 million worth of Bitcoin. National Bitcoin Office Director Stacy Herbert stated in late December that the country's Bitcoin strategy remains unchanged. A spokesperson from the Bitcoin Office also confirmed to Cointelegraph that El Salvador plans to continue buying Bitcoin, with intentions to "intensify in 2025."

data.title: Chairman of the U.S. Senate Banking Committee: Two crypto bills may be passed by the Senate within 100 days of Trump taking office
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News On Tuesday, David Sacks, the White House AI and cryptocurrency director, held his first cryptocurrency-focused press conference on Tuesday, outlining legislative priorities and revealing the Trump administration's first major move to regulate the emerging industry: a market structure bill and a comprehensive stablecoin bill.
At the event attended by key leaders of the Senate and the House of Representatives, Senate Banking Committee Chairman Tim Scott said he intends to get the two key cryptocurrency bills passed in the Senate before the end of President Trump's 100th day in office, a deadline of less than three months from today.
Scott added that a stablecoin bill introduced by Senator Bill Hagery on Tuesday may be the first to be passed. (Decrypt)

data.title: Institution: DeepSeek's impact on the AI ​​chip market this year is limited, and the global semiconductor market is expected to grow by 13.4% annually in 2025
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: DeepSeek impacts the AI ​​supply chain. DIGITIMES Research said that DeepSeek will not impact the AI ​​chip market demand in 2025. In 2025, the global semiconductor industry revenue will continue the trend of 2024, and is expected to increase by 13.4% year-on-year to a peak of US$714 billion. (Jinshi)

data.title: Shiba Inu Partners with UAE Ministry of Energy to Implement Blockchain in Government Operations
data.description: According to a report from Watcher.guru, Shiba Inu (SHIB) has announced a partnership with the United Arab Emirates Ministry of Energy and Infrastructure (MOEI) to integrate its blockchain-based operating system, ShibOS, into government activities. This partnership represents the first instance of a government globally implementing blockchain technology at the federal level. The Shiba Inu team expressed enthusiasm about this pioneering venture, emphasizing the potential of ShibOS to revolutionize public sector operations by introducing enhanced transparency, security, and efficiency.UAE's Blockchain Strategy and Economic ImpactThe UAE has outlined a comprehensive blockchain strategy that aims to transition 50% of government transactions onto blockchain platforms. This strategic shift is expected to save more than $3 billion annually in transaction and document processing fees. Sharif Al Olama, the UAE's Deputy Minister of Energy and Petroleum Affairs, highlighted the significance of this collaboration, stating, "We are pleased to deepen our commitment to cutting-edge digital services. This collaboration marks a critical step in our journey to redefine government services."
